intro: Isoglossa ovata, commonly known as the oval isoglossa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Isoglossa ovata typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
